title: Bug 118780 - Expression builder shows old column names instead of aliases in dataset
description: After setting aliases for columns in a dataset, the expression builder still displays the old column names when selecting the dataset in the expression builder.
OB: When selecting the dataset and double-clicking on the first column name in the expression builder, the original name of the column is listed below the expression builder.
EB: According to scr 78193 in the tracker, the first column in the expression builder should use the alias name instead of the original name. However, after double-clicking the original name, the alias name appears as row['column1'] above.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new datasource and a dataset.
2. Set the alias of the first column in the dataset to 'column1'.
3. Insert a data item and bind it to the dataset.
4. Open the expression builder and select the dataset.
5. Double-click on the first column name and observe the displayed name in the expression builder.
